page.title: 05What's found in Kylesku?
page.content: This area is of world wide interest to geologists. Some of the oldest rock in Britain is found here, rock so old that no fossils are found in it. Younger rock has been found under this older rock _ this has been caused by upthrusting and folding, "The Moine Thrust". Many diffferent species of birds can be seen. Terns plunge from the air on the shoals of mackerel in the loch, watched by the cormorants. On a narrow ledge on one of the cliffs is a heronry. Oyster_catchers and gulls add their noise to the scene. On land pied wagtails are the first signs of spring joining the tits and finches which have been looked after all winter. Later the cuckoo and the summmer birds arrive. The buzzard is the largest bird of prey seen in our area, though eagles are found far up the glens.
